data.title: Audio noise
data.body:
The ninja and sound demos generate noise in the background, only in this engine/game. 
In Windows 7 with Directx9.

data.title: Some flags for AssertImporter
data.body:
Add this flags to AssertImporter please.

-fwd
Force set diffuse colour to white

-dtc
Disable copying textures.

-eao
Forse use AO technique if emissive texture used

Also if texture copy is enabled, need to check - "destination texture exist?"

In some cases AssertImporter copy textures with zero size and owerwrite not zero-sized textures..

data.title: expose IntRect IsInside(IntVector2)
data.body: I am having to check to see if a cursor is inside an IntRect.  I have had to do this a couple times by manually for some UI work.  It might be useful to have IntRect#IsInside(IntVector2)

data.title: Rigidbody Sliding
data.body: I am developing a physics-based game that takes place on a spherical planet; the standard Bullet gravity is turned off and a custom gravity system using the ApplyForce function has been implemented as a set of custom components. The problem, however, is that all rigidbodies seem to slide on a surface when they should be at rest- even if friction and linear damping are set to absurdly high values. I have investigated further and found that this behavior is exhibited even in a completely normal setting- rigidbodies seem to drift along whatever surface they're on, usually in the positive Z-direction. I have tested this using triangle meshes, convex hulls, and spheres as CollisionShapes, with the same results.

data.title: CollisionShape in editor exports insufficient information
data.body:
EDIT: I had a redundant shape assignment inside my XML code. I removed the line, and the body still will not respond to forces. Please close this ticket, I'll put updated info into a new one.

If one makes a CollisionShape in the editor and save the associated node structure to an XML, necessary information is not exported. This resulted in the body's inability to respond to ApplyTorque. Supplying the necessary values enables the body to respond.

data.title: Spline class
data.body:
Add spline class with two interplation modes: linear and bezier. It allow to smooth move objects along spline ex. for tech demos and so on.
Also may add editing spline in editor by moving spline points.

data.title: Integrate Ogre3D like Unity build?
data.body: Would you plan to add Unity build system like Ogre3D for faster compilation times?

data.title: Add in editor camera view option
data.body:
Currently there is no camera view option in the editor 
this will be useful to see how the scene is viewed from camera view in game.

data.title: Add option in the editor to export the scene as c++ code
data.body:
Currently the Editor export the scene as xml file , this xml can be very big and 
when using it in code it can cause some delay i loading time ,
also sometimes you don't want your scene to be exposed as text file 
so it will be very useful to add the option to export the scene as c++ code .

data.title: Angelscript Header added in Install Target
data.body: I was wondering whether the Angelscript Header should be added to the install target if ENABLE_ANGELSCRIPT is defined, it would seem to make sense as it will be required if the user wants to bind any of their own functions to scripts.

data.title: Water example
data.body: Add water example with reflection/refraction.

data.title: Adds the ability to patch together two XMLFiles
data.body:
Based on the [RFC 5261](http://tools.ietf.org/search/rfc5261) with handling of Add, Replace and Remove for nodes and attributes. No handling has been added for namespace::prefix modifications at the moment.

Closes #118.

Here's an example patch:

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<root>
    <foo id="1"/>
    <foo id="2"/>
    <foo id="3">
        <bar>I was already here</bar>
    </foo>
    <foo id="4">
        Here is a text element.
        <bar>Now We're a bar.</bar>
        Here is a text element.
    </foo>
    <foo id="5"/>
    <foo id="6"/>
</root>
```

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<root>
    <!-- test default append -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='3']"><bar>I was appended</bar></add>
    <!-- test multiple prepend -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='3']" pos="prepend">
        <bar>I was prepended first</bar>
        <bar>I was prepended second</bar>
     </add>
    <!-- test before -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='2']" pos="before"><foo id="1.5" /></add>
    <!-- test after -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='2']" pos="after"><foo id="2.5" /></add>

    <!-- test add attribute -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='1']" type="@moo">grass</add>

    <!-- test before with combine text -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='4']/bar" pos="before">
        Add me last to the end of the next text element. 
        <goo />
    </add>

    <!-- test after with combine text -->
    <add sel="/root/foo[@id='4']/bar" pos="after">
        <goo />
        Add me first to the start of the prior text element.        
    </add>   

    <!-- test replace element -->
    <replace sel="/root/foo[@id='2']">
        <foo id='2'>
            <bar>I'm new round here, fancy a drink?</bar>
        </foo>
    </replace>

    <!-- test remove element -->
    <remove sel="/root/foo[@id='5']" />

    <!-- test remove attribute -->
    <remove sel="/root/foo[@id='6']/@id" />
</root>
```

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root>
    <foo id="1" moo="grass" />
    <foo id="1.5" />
    <foo id="2">
        <bar>I'm new round here, fancy a drink?</bar>
    </foo>
    <foo id="2.5" />
    <foo id="3">
        <bar>I was prepended first</bar>
        <bar>I was prepended second</bar>
        <bar>I was already here</bar>
        <bar>I was appended</bar>
    </foo>
    <foo id="4">
        Here is a text element. Add me last to the end of the next text element. 
        <goo />
        <bar>Now We're a bar.</bar>
        <goo />
        Add me first to the start of the prior text element. Here is a text element.
    </foo>
    <foo />
</root>
```

data.title: XML Diff Patch (RFC 5261)
data.body:
We're just coming to the start of implementing the Diff Patch methods for Xml as detailed here: [RFC 5261](http://tools.ietf.org/search/rfc5261), with as much functionality as possible allowed by pugi xml's XPath support.

We were wondering if you'd be interested in having it as part of Urho3D itself, something along the following lines:

``` C++
XMLFile* a = resourceCache->GetResource<XMLFile>("a.xml");
XMLFile* b = resourceCache->GetResource<XMLFile>("b.xml");

a->Patch(b);
```

a.xml:

``` xml
<root>
    <foo a="1" />
    <foo a="2" />
</root>
```

b.xml

``` xml
<root>
    <add sel="*/foo[@a='1']" pos="before">
        <foo a="3"/>
        <!-- comment -->
    </add>
</root>
```

XMLFile\* a underlying document after:

``` xml
<root> 
    <foo a="3"/>
    <!-- comment -->
    <foo a="1"/>
    <foo a="2"/>
</root>
```

data.title: memleak when SubscribeToEvent
Do not change alpha of UI while scroll by mouse in editor

data.title: AO with Alpha and AlphaMask
data.body: Add AO with Alpha and AlphaMask permutation please.

data.title: Improving log class to support format specifiers
data.body:
currently the Log class support only String (inner Class)  writing , that is the formatting is done outside 
the log function . or defining new String class for each type .
but this will force to use formatting function over and over way to time consuming 
why not support the format specifiers in the Log::Write function it self. 
so for example we could do some thing like this :

```
float f = 3.3f;
LOGDEBUG("%f ",f);
```

you can take example from cocos2d-x log macros in
cocos2d-x-3.0alpha1\cocos\base\CCPlatformMacros.h

data.title: Cmake create separate directory's for Debug and Release compilations in windows
data.body:
Today when i compile from visual studio all the products are created in Urho3D\Bin
separated suffix needs to be created for each build 
for example for Debug the suffix should be :
Urho3DPlayer_d.exe
and for release it will be without the "_d" suffix

data.title: Using Urho3D as external library is broken
data.body: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/commit/4458725fed1d9930bdfc2fd2e13d086c1ade33ee uses ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}, which will point to the external project's Build directory, instead of Urho3D's.  External projects will not find Urho3D.h.

data.title: stores 5 most recently used scenes in editor
data.body:
this stores the most recently open scenes.  change the const maxRecentSceneCount to tweak the number 5 seems a bit skimpy.  i don't know why that number made sense.  nothing makes sense when you code late.

gn & thanks for all the fish
Chris

data.title: adds mousewheel translation in editor
data.body: I don't really know much about how the mouse wheels change over systems but a fudge multiplier of 20 felt good on my setup.

data.title: Added Asynchronous Resource Loading using WorkItems.
Don't cache geometry with dynamic vertex buffers.
data.body: CollisionShape's for Triangle and Convex meshes are cached.  Vertex buffers marked as Dynamic will change frequently so arguably shouldn't be cached anyway; this patch prevents caching of dynamic geometry.

data.title: Add the ability to allow pure script objects that are not created through a ScriptInstance to handle events
Line edit practices
data.body:
I believe these are common behaviors for a line edit (sure for Win/Linux).
I'm worried about changing UI::SetFocusElement() arguments, if there is a cleaner solution please comment.

data.title: Improvement Documentation
data.body: The current documentation is confusing and small, think that's something important to fix.

data.title: added fallback for non-drawable components when orbiting
data.body: added the node position for components that aren't drawable. sorry about not handle that circumstance.

data.title: Black decal color.
data.body:
Hi guys and a happy new 2014!
i cant see my decals with black color, i want use it for my skid tires , with all colors work, but when i use "0 0 0 1" i see nothing, my material:

```
<material>
    <technique name="Techniques/DiffAdd.xml" />
    <texture unit="diffuse" name="skids.dds" />
    <parameter name="MatDiffColor" value="0 0 0 1" />
    <depthbias constant="-0.00001" slopescaled="0" />
</material>
```

Thanks !

data.title: orbit around all selected nodes/components
data.body:
If by some miracle the user find the correct keyboard/mouse combinations to select multiple nodes / components the orbit will go around the median of the selected.

I tried to do the bounding box center but it was kind of difficult do to the arbitrary nesting of nodes.

Thanks,
Chris
